chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
items.plainText: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.

items.text: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:
items.plainText: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:

items.text: And let us arise, and go up to Beth-el; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
items.plainText: And let us arise, and go up to Beth-el; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.

items.text: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
items.plainText: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.

items.text: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
items.plainText: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.

items.text: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Beth-el, he and all the people that were with him.
items.plainText: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Beth-el, he and all the people that were with him.

items.text: And he built there an altar, and called the place El-beth-el: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
items.plainText: And he built there an altar, and called the place El-beth-el: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.

items.text: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Beth-el under an oak: and the name of it was called Allon-bachuth.
items.plainText: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Beth-el under an oak: and the name of it was called Allon-bachuth.

items.text: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padan-aram, and blessed him.
items.plainText: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padan-aram, and blessed him.

items.text: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
items.plainText: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.

items.text: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
items.plainText: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;

items.text: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
items.plainText: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.

items.text: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
items.plainText: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.

items.text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
items.plainText: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.

items.text: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Beth-el.
items.plainText: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Beth-el.

items.text: And they journeyed from Beth-el; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.
items.plainText: And they journeyed from Beth-el; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.

items.text: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
items.plainText: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.

items.text: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Ben-oni: but his father called him Benjamin.
items.plainText: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Ben-oni: but his father called him Benjamin.

items.text: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Beth-lehem.
items.plainText: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Beth-lehem.

items.text: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.
items.plainText: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.

items.text: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
items.plainText: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.

items.text: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
items.plainText: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:

items.text: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
items.plainText: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:

items.text: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
items.plainText: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:

items.text: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:
items.plainText: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:

items.text: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padan-aram.
items.plainText: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padan-aram.

items.text: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
items.plainText: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.

items.text: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
items.plainText: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.

items.text: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
items.plainText: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
